description: Mary E. Brunkow, Fred Ramsdell, and Shimon Sakaguchi received the 2025 Nobel Prize for their discoveries in peripheral immune tolerance. Sakaguchi identified regulatory T cells, while Brunkow and Ramsdell linked FOXP3 gene mutations to T-reg dysfunction, revolutionizing understanding of immune regulation and opening new therapeutic avenues for autoimmune diseases and cancer.

title: Nobel Medicine Prize: How three scientists found the body's peacekeepers
description: Your immune system is your body’s army. It fights off viruses, bacteria, and infections every day. Its elite soldiers are called T cells. This marks a significant challenge for President Emmanuel Macron, who faces immense pressure to secure broad support and demonstrate a clear break from previous policies amidst a divided parliament.

title: Japanese government invites Indians for jobs, higher studies

title: Bengal: BJP MP attacked while visiting flood-affected area; party blames TMC
description: BJP MP Khagen Murmu sustained serious head injuries after being attacked by locals with stones while visiting flood-affected areas in North Bengal. The incident occurred as he was overseeing relief operations, prompting the BJP to condemn the ruling TMC for targeting leaders engaged in humanitarian work amidst severe flooding and landslides.

description: India maintained their perfect Women's World Cup record, defeating Pakistan by 88 runs to extend their dominance to 12-0. The intense rivalry spilled onto the field with skipped handshakes, heated exchanges, and a controversial run-out. Deepti Sharma, involved in a clash with Sidra Amin, was ironically named best fielder. India now faces South Africa and Australia next.

title: Mid-air scare: Pilots' body writes to DGCA after RAT deployed on Air India flight
description: The DGCA is investigating an uncommanded Ram Air Turbine (RAT) deployment on an Air India flight (AI-117) at 400ft before landing in Birmingham on October 4, 2025. Despite Boeing's recommended maintenance finding no discrepancies, the regulator deemed a detailed probe necessary, especially given a recent fatal Air India 787 crash.

description: Gold price prediction today: Gold prices are expected to maintain their bullish rally, driven by robust safe-haven demand amid intensifying geopolitical and economic uncertainty, including the US government shutdown and rising Fed rate cut expectations.

title: 'Sanatan ka apmaan nahi sahenge': Lawyer tries to hurl shoe towards CJI in SC; how he reacted
description: An advocate hurled a shoe at CJI BR Gavai in protest against his recent "go ask your deity" remark concerning a Lord Vishnu idol's reconstruction plea. Shouting slogans about Sanatan Dharma, the individual was quickly escorted out. CJI Gavai remained unfazed, stating such incidents do not affect him or the court's proceedings.

title: Riyadh Season 2025 kick-off: Opening parade, celebrity lineup, & top attractions
description: Riyadh Season 2025 officially kicks off on Friday, October 10, with a spectacular grand parade and six immersive entertainment zones. Featuring global stars, major sporting events like Six Kings Slam, and music festivals, the season promises diverse cultural experiences and thrilling adventures. Tickets start at SAR 25, offering fun for all ages.

title: Arattai launch: Anand Mahindra backs ‘Made in India’ app; Zoho founder replies
description: Zoho's homegrown messaging app, Arattai, recently gained immense popularity, topping Indian app stores as a "spyware-free, made-in-India" alternative. Industrialist Anand Mahindra publicly endorsed the app, prompting a grateful response from Zoho founder Sridhar Vembu. Despite its rapid rise, Arattai is currently addressing user-reported issues like OTP delays and call glitches.

Gold prices hit record highs: US shutdown, Fed rate cut bets boost demand
description: Gold prices surged to unprecedented levels globally and domestically, driven by safe-haven demand amidst the US government shutdown and anticipated Federal Reserve rate cuts. MCX gold futures hit new records, with the February 2026 contract reaching Rs 1,20,845 per 10 grams. Silver also rallied significantly as investors sought safety, despite mixed physical demand.

description: India clinched a dominant 88-run victory over Pakistan in the 2025 Women's World Cup, with all-rounder Deepti Sharma earning the best fielder medal for her crucial direct hit run-out. India posted 247 runs, dismissing Pakistan for 159, and now leads the tournament table. Upcoming matches include South Africa and defending champions Australia, promising more thrilling cricket.

They accused Tesi of extorting 5 million from singers in the gang's name. The group issued warnings against false accusations and spreading misinformation, emphasizing respect for honest individuals.

The offering, closing October 8, aims to augment Tier-I capital and support future lending expansion.

description: The Supreme Court issued notice to the central government and Ladakh UT. This action addresses Sonam Wangchuk's detention after violent protests in Ladakh. His wife challenged his arrest under the National Security Act. Wangchuk advocated for Ladakh's statehood and 6th Schedule inclusion. Authorities alleged he incited violence. His wife sought presidential intervention for his release.

Living alone, cooking his own meals, and navigating language barriers, he continues to hone his skills, even if it means risking a spot in India’s World Cup qualifiers. Hope for Indian hoops arrives with the country’s first professional league in 2026.

The incident tragically resulted in patient deaths and exposed critical safety lapses within the facility.

Row breaks out over ‘inauguration’ plaque at community centre in village in Northwest Delhi
Coldrif cough syrup banned in several states; FDA cites toxic industrial solvent as cause of deaths
description: Maharashtra FDA has imposed a statewide ban on Coldrif syrup (Batch No. SR-13) after it was linked to 14 child fatalities in neighboring states due to diethylene glycol contamination. Concurrently, Nagpur's FDA restricted Anset syrup following safety concerns and tip-offs from affected families. This two-pronged response underscores intensified efforts to prevent further loss of life.

title: Delhi: Man arrested for running ‘sextortion racket’ by posing as cyber police officer
UK mosque set on fire in East Sussex in suspected hate crime, no injuries reported
Don’t harass traders with unnecessary raids during Dhanteras & Diwali: CM Yogi to tax officials
Jail escape bid foiled: Ghaziabad cops use fake order to free 2 prisoners; arrested
description: Two police constables tried to facilitate the release of two inmates from Dasna Jail. They presented documents they claimed were court orders. Jail officials noted discrepancies in the papers. A verification call confirmed no court productions were scheduled. The constables then fled the scene. They were later suspended and arrested. An investigation into their motives and connections is now underway.

title: Harjit or Sarabjit? US-deported grandma fights name muddle; explains dual names
description: Deported from the US after three decades, Harjit Kaur clarified her identity to TOI amidst name confusion. Official records confirm her birth name as Sarabjit, though some family use Harjit. While a 1992 marriage certificate lists her as Harjit, she maintains all her documents are Sarabjit. She also refuted social media allegations of impersonation, asserting her true identity.

title: Watch: Rowdy celebrates birthday inside Bengaluru prison; video goes viral
description: A viral video shows undertrial prisoner Gubbachhi Seena celebrating his birthday with cake and a large knife inside Bengaluru's Central Prison, prompting an ADGP inquiry. The celebration, recorded on a mobile phone, occurred months ago. Seena, accused of murder, had his rival's wife expose the clip. Police are now investigating mobile phone entry and facilitation of the event.

title: Mark Kastelic charges at Rangers’ 6'9" Matt Rempe, refuses to flinch
description: Bruins' new forward Mark Kastelic charged Rangers' Matt Rempe in their final preseason game after both left the penalty box. This incident followed earlier physical plays and penalties, showcasing Kastelic's gritty character despite a significant size disadvantage. The fight, deemed a draw, highlighted Kastelic's readiness for tough bottom-six roles ahead of the Bruins' October 2025 season opener.

title: Chiefs heiress Gracie Hunt questions wellness after Austin health experience
description: Kansas City Chiefs heiress Gracie Hunt recently experienced an "eye-opening" holistic wellness assessment at Medici Health, Austin. This comprehensive check-up, spanning heart screenings to vision tests, profoundly highlighted the critical importance of proactive self-care before health issues emerge. Hunt lauded the compassionate team and the Phillips family's vision, advocating for health as a continuous, empowering journey for all.

title: Wayne Gretzky & Janet Jones’ love story: From dance fever to 30 years of marriage
description: Hockey legend Wayne Gretzky and Janet Jones' enduring love story began with a chance meeting in 1981, reigniting at a 1987 Lakers game. Their shared mindset led to a whirlwind romance, a "royal wedding" in 1988, and a family of five children. They prioritized family, making their decades-long marriage a true victory off the ice.
